greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest number such that a(n)+a(n-1), a(n)+a(n-1)+a(n-2), ..., a(n)+...+a(1) are not prime.
comment: No sum of a continuous subsequence is ever prime. The sequence consists only of multiples of 3 after n=4?
program: (PARI) { checkprime(a,b)=local(fl); fl=0; for (i=1,b-1,if (isprime(a+s[i]),fl=1; break)); fl } { p=vector(100); p[1]=1; pc=2; while (pc<100, x=1; s=vector(100); for (i=1,pc-1,s[i]=sum(k=i,pc-1,p[k])); i=1; while (checkprime(x,pc),x++); p[pc]=x; pc++); p }
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Jun 06 2003
